pullRequest.body:
Infrastructure for working with [monomial orders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monomial_order) on MvPolynomial rings. The lexicographic order is used in #6593 (proof of the fundamental theorem of symmetric polynomials)

---

nodes.body:
> This is really great!  I find the simplifications arising in MvPolynomials are a great sign that defining "degree"s at the level of `AddMonoidAlgebra`s is a step in the right directions!

Yeah actually most of the golfs in Variables.lean was already enabled by your previous PRs; you may not have looked into that file but in any case you made a wise choice to use `Finset.sup` to define `supDegree`!

> Did you try seeing if [Polynomial.Monic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/Definitions.html#Polynomial.Monic) could be deduplicated with the newly introduced one?

The main obstacle is that [Polynomial](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Basic.html#Polynomial) is not defeq to [AddMonoidAlgebra](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/Basic.html#AddMonoidAlgebra) R [â„•](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Prelude.html#Nat) but a structure with a single field. I think there's no harm making them defeq except maybe potential timeouts. This PR just develop API for AddMonoidAlgebra and the fundamental theorem proof applies them directly to MvPolynomial without explicitly transferring the API (apart from [three lemmas](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7173/files#diff-44a6991ac2378d95670e90022cfa47893ba843ebb7f8d4aa1dbd3082d54c5ac5R805-R816)), so the proof is abusing the non-reducible defeq in some sense, but it works without trouble.

I had not been exhaustive about golfing, since I wanted to not clutter too much the PR with the definition.  I'm very happy that, now that the definitions are in, they simplify proofs!

With respect to the divide between `Polynomial, MvPolynomial, Finsupp`, Eric and I had a quick chat about it and we both think that `AddMonoidAlgebra` should be the breaking point, not `Polynomial`.  At `AddMonoidAlgebra` is where the `Finsupp` type acquires the alternative multiplication and it makes sense to make that one the `structure` instead of the next layer up, `Polynomial`s.

I'm not sure that I have the strength to embark in such a refactor though, certainly not so close to the beginning of my teaching term!
I've noticed that the module docstring currently refers to some non-existent `maxDegree` and doesn't match current implementation very well, so I did a complete revision.
Is this still supposed to be `awaiting-author`?
